The initial kinetic energy of block C is $\frac{1}{2}mv_{0}^{2}$.
The kinetic energy of blocks B and C after the collision is $\frac{1}{2}(2m)v^{2}$.
The work done by friction during the motion of block C is $\mu mgs_{0}$.
The mechanical energy loss during the collision is the difference between the initial kinetic energy of C and the kinetic energy of B and C after the collision minus the work done by friction.
Simplifying the expression gives the mechanical energy loss as $\frac{1}{4}m(v_{0}^{2}-2\mu g s_{0})$.
